article:
This article is related to law. For the personality trait, see [[Dependent
personality disorder|Dependent Personality Disorder]]

A 'dependant' (British English) or 'dependent' (American English) is a person
who relies on another as a primary source of income. For example, a minor child,
under the age of majority, is a dependant of his or her parent and the existence
of the dependant may enable the provider, such as a parent or guardian, to claim
a deduction, for example in income tax calculations.
